title: Roman Abramovich
added: An investigation by [[BBC News Arabic]] into the [[FinCEN Files]] in September 2020 found Abramovich-controlled companies have donated $100m to the [[Ir David Foundation]] (known as Elad), an Israeli organization that supports Jewish settlements in [[Silwan]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Garthwaite|first1=Rosie|last2=Blau|first2=Uri|last3=Cox|first3=Simon|date=21 September 2020|title=Israeli settlers' Chelsea boss backer|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/av/world-middle-east-54237970/|access-date=22 September 2020|website=[[BBC News]]|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Holmes|first=Oliver|title=Leaks show Chelsea owner Abramovich funded Israeli settler group|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/sep/21/leaks-show-chelsea-owner-abramovich-funded-israeli-settler-group/|access-date=22 September 2020|website=The Guardian|date=21 September 2020|language=en}}</ref> Due to Israel's ongoing [[Israeli occupation of the West Bank|occupation of the West Bank]], the settlements are generally considered to be a [[International law and Israeli settlements|breach of international law]], a view which Israel disputes.{{sfn|Playfair|1992|p=396}}{{sfn|Albin|2001|p=150}}<ref>{{Cite news|date=10 December 2009|title=The Geneva Convention|language=en-GB|work=BBC News|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/1682640.stm|access-date=18 June 2021}}</ref>
